abstract: BlackRock has added its name to the list of those opposing the $60.50 per share, $3.1 billion buyout of Laureate Education. But the go-shop window has closed without a better offer. BlackRock sent a letter Monday to the Laureate independent board members stating that without an increase it would not support the management buyout backed by a consortium including Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, Citigroup Private Equity and SAC Capital Management.
lead_paragraph: BlackRock has added its name to the list of those opposing the $60.50 per share, $3.1 billion buyout of Laureate Education. But the go-shop window has closed without a better offer. BlackRock sent a letter Monday to the Laureate independent board members stating that without an increase it would not support the management buyout backed by a consortium including Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, Citigroup Private Equity and SAC Capital Management.

headline.main: BlackRock Joins Growing Opposition to Laureate Buyout
